reviews.text: Was closed with locked fence though a couple people hopped the fence. From the fence you'll see a couple buildings and a stone grave or monument marker. Oldest building was falling and doesn't appear to be a replica of the original lodge so just some stone markers with a bit of history.

Very misleading to show a picture of a cute little cabin. There are NO reconstructed buildings or stockade there! Just an open field, old barn from this era and granite monument. Even the 4 grave stones are gone.
Beautiful land and a simple grass walking trail await.
Very pretty scenery. Relaxing walk

The Kentucky Theatre is such a cool place!  The ambiance of the theatre is remarkable for special events and small concerts.  We've been here for a few movies.  There summer movie series can be a lot of fun.  My only complaint would be the movie selection.  There is rarely movies that we want to watch, but I wish they'd have more.
Love the new snack bar. Always a class place to see a movie. The ladies restroom was roomy and clean. Will definitely be heading back to see more movies there.
Love the ambiance of this restored old time theatre. Eclectic films as well as some new releases. Also summer film series is great fun.
Always has a great selection of movie. While the sound and picture isn't as good as most modern theaters the atmosphere makes up for it

I love this theater the retro movie experience is just a fresh experience in the world of overpriced large cinemas. The theaters themselves are breathtaking to even just sit in. I want to see all movies here.

I call this the City. Lol.  You have buildings with more than two floors , yup the City. 
Have to say Lexington is really nice. The Park love to see the kids and adults have fun. Really makes you feel good.
I miss the older version of the park with the taller, older trees. But I guess this works better as a green space now. Park is a little small but works for the most part.

It’s a small but beautiful park in the middle of downtown Lexington. Stop in and get a coffee at the Starbucks across the street and then sit and enjoy the water fountain and watch cars zipping by. In the winter they build an ice skating rink so that’s pretty cool! A sweet place to pack a lunch and eat or look up a yoga group to join on the grass lawn. A Lexington landmark for sure
Down town nices place to set and walk around Holtel near by
This park is  close to downtown no public restrooms

I'm glad you replied.  I thought I had hit 5 starts not 4.
Tonight was the first night I had visited here.  The atmosphere was great and it had a great mix of people it seemed from all ages and walks of life.  The decor is a little retro, a little funk, a little class, but all unique.  Although what I ordered wasn't on the menu, the staff said they could do it for me anyway.  This makes it a memorable place and one I will return to. 
Only negative was that there was a couple of empty mugs on the tabke we saw we wanted to sit at.  But that isn't enough if a negative to even lose a star for. 
 I'm glad I came here.  I'll see you soon again. 
BUY LOCAL!!

My new face hang out in Lex!  This place is amazing.  Welcoming.  Safe for all!  Love the art, style, friendly staff...coffee was SO good.  Food was delicious.   Desserts incredible.  The coolest hangout in Lex.  You must try it!
Super cute and eclectic. Great place to read, write, have meetings, or just socialize. Great food, drink, and atmosphere!

I have lived in Lexington for over 20 years and passed by this place hundreds of times, but never ventured in until today. Just as fun inside as it is outside. Lots of color and kitsch. They serve coffee and drinks, breakfast and lunch things. Unique and comfy seating.
Very cool atmosphere and friendly staff! I like their specialized coffees with awesome names. I couldn't decide between the Sojourner Truth or the Angela Davis!

Incredibly cozy and cute. Loved the regulars vibe I felt from the place. Had an excellent time! Felt like I was in a library, or coffee shop, but sat by a fire with some great drinks and conversation. Loved it.

Charlie browns is an extremely unique spot located in Chevy Chase. This bar/restaurant has an incredible atmosphere, which consists of a bar, couch seating, coffee tables, and regular bar top tables. The lighting is dim and the space is very relaxing and calm. It's a great place for any occasion. Not to mention the drink deals are heavenly, and the food is super scrumptious.

The service was amazing, waitress checked in frequently. The food came out quickly and was good. Overall the best part was the atmosphere. Warm inside on a cold day, just the right lighting, comfortable couches, bookshelves line the walls... And if you're with someone special, the waitress knows when to conveniently stop checking in for a moment while you guys talk.
Great hole in the wall spot to go to. You have to try the hot pepper cheese. Very unique vibe with a wide variety of mixed drinks you can buy by the liter.

Charlie Brown's is my favorite dive bar in Lexington. The food is good and the prices are great. The atmosphere is what really makes it unique, its a great little hide away to go and relax and hang out with friends. I recommend it to everyone. Most unique place on Lexington.

They have been around for quite some time and I like visiting them when I can. Their bakery selections are delightful and once you get to know them, you will know that they are pleasant people. The place is clean and I love their cakes and fruit tarts.

Lovely little French bakery and wine store
Locally owned and delicious
I hadn’t been here in years. Nice place for lunch and great pastries. Bring cash or use the ATM around the corner.

Just because they don't constantly have a moronic grin on their faces all the time like most people in KY it doesn't mean that they are rude. They have always been extremely pleasant and professional with me, and I have been going there since age 3. And yes they only take cash or local checks. I don't know why this is such a big deal. They also provide extremely high quality food at reasonable prices. If they were to accept credit cards they would also have to raise their prices accordingly.

I have been buying wine here for years, but recently I had a bottle that was spoiled. When I brought it back to the owner, he told me I was lying about getting it from his shop, and refused to replace the bottle giving me excuses that I know don’t make any sense. I’m friends with wine distributors who tell me how easy it is to replace a bottle. The owner also did not offer me a discount on a new bottle, which is odd because he sees me in there frequently. He just told me he couldn’t help me, and when I told him I would no longer be purchasing wine from him he really didn’t care. Sadly, I would advise you not to buy from this place. His prices can be competitive at times, but bottle spoilage is totally normal... this bro is not willing to replace something that happens all the time in the industry.

There were only about 4 tables with people when we went there.  Had to wait about 10min for someone to notice us and seat us.  We ordered.  An hour later, and no exaggeration, the waitress came to tell us they were out of hamburgers.  So after an hour they started our order?  And most of the other tables had already been served, so I have no idea what was going on. When the finally brought the food, an hour and a half after we got there, my  onion rings were inedible - burnt and saturated with grease so they were literally sitting in a pool of grease.

Disappointed in the service and food.  Typically we have had both good food and service while dining here, but tonight was not the case.  The waitress informed us that it was under new management.  The menu has changed a bit.  Way overpriced for the quality of food we received tonight.  My husband ordered the meatloaf and it was so dry it tasted horrible.  Certainly not worth $14.00.  I had the hot brown, totally made wrong.  I have had several hot browns from various restaurants and this was the worst.  The layer of bread was covered in ham/turkey as usual, but the sauce that goes over this typically is a heavy cream/butter/parmesan sauce, but instead they used white gravy (like you would have with biscuits).  There was one tiny tomato slice hidden under the cheese and one half piece of bacon.  The taste was totally wrong, they should not market this as a hot brown, yuck!  They try to cover the mess in about a pound of melted cheese.  The service was slow, we ran out of water, never got a refill.  If this is what is expected of new management as they "revamp" the menu then no thanks, I will not be back.  For $30 I can have a better meal for less at several other establishments in the area.

Server was great. Food was okay as usual. Somewhat overpriced. However tonight they stopped serving 3 of us because 2 of us  had had 8 beers combined. The third was a designated driver who was drinking water. We were ther for the atmosphere, s few drinks and to enjoy the music at Lakeside Live. Get real!

Stopped at Bronte Bistro while on a family outing at the bookstore. Our wonderful experience came on behalf of our server and the restaurant manger. Genuine conversation, a great sense of humor, and they even went above and beyond great customer service by completing our meal with a complimentary dessert (for our 5yr old daughter) and food to feed the ducks. The food was hot and seasoned to perfection, and generously portioned. This has been by far my best experience from a restaurant and waiter.

Really disappointed with our visit. Our appetizers got burned and another had to be made. Wait staff was incredibly slow and unorganized, had two different people come to wait on us. My husband ordered catfish and got one little plank, he had a cup and a half of tartar sauce for one little 2 inch plank of fish! My hotbrown was like warm and my tomato still had the dark brown stalk in the center. Would have rated this lower but our cocktails were amazing. Kudos to the bartender.

I had only ever heard great things about Parkette! I decided to try it out and I was not disappointed!! The Beer Cheese burger was UNBELIEVABLE. I also got a big chicken box which had an insane amount of food for the price! The chicken was fantastic and how could you not get their crispy tater tots! I will be back 1,000,000 times over again, I had a great experience and my carhop was wonderful! I can't wait to eat in next time!

I chose this place while in Kentucky for a baseball tournament. The fried chicken is excellent but the real winner here is the gravy, I put that shhhh on everything. I dipped the fries, the chicken and my fingers in this heavenly concoction. I came in with a group of 25, they were very accommodating and accurate with our order. Definitely worth the visit.

Parkette Drive-In is a 1950's style drive-in diner where you can still get curb service in your car, or dine inside if you prefer. Their menu includes burgers, fries, fish, chicken, shrimp, chili, and milkshakes, as well as many other items. Give this place a try and return to the nostalgic 1950's. It's a fun place to go.

Randy and his gorgeous team give you the best time you can have in a restaurant! The food is delicious and the atmosphere is great!
We came all the way from Germany and will come back for sure.

Found this place on Roadside America. Also it was featured on the Food network. Low prices with large portions. Food came out quickly and was very delicious. Loved all the vintage plates throughout the restaurant 
Highly recommend this place

Excellent choices of seafood. The fish selection is amazing! Definitely worth a stop if your in the area. The atmosphere is great. For those like myself hearing impaired I could hear everything very nicely.

The food is not very good. Extremely overpriced. I had a bad piece of fish, which The server touted.  They were out of salmon on a Friday night?  The service wasn't bad. It's not good enough for me to go back, but mainly because none of the food was good. Not a good experience.
Great food, nice drink menu, and the atmosphere is very relaxing. I highly recommend Grillfish. I will continue to come back. NEVER disappointed
Always delicious!  Fresh seafood grilled and seasoned perfectly and the rack of lamb was perfection.  Love eating here!
Excellent fish restaurant. Nice service. Definite I will be there again.

Ordered 2 specials last night, one medium well, one well, the medium well was cooked more than the well!!, it was almost medium rare, but have to say even if  it had been cooked right , only 1/4 was edible, it was all grizzle. And we love Columbia’s but the last 2 times steak had been chewy, grizzly, or not cooked as asked, some ppl do like their steak well done, it’d be nice if you got it like that,
, no more express for us, at least in the eat in you can have them cook it more, I’m 30 minutes away so can’t happen with express, also salad, had 1 radish. A few tomatoes and the rest just lettuce with some of it darkened in color, very disappointed in Columbia’s last night
Friday night we drove about 45 minutes to Southland Dr. on a whim, got home and enjoyed a near perfect meal, next time it won’t be such a long wait between visits!
Got the Night hawk Special, always amazing!
Great food. Prime rib sandwich is awesome.

Placed a order for 3 fish sandwich meals a loaded baked potatoe and dessert..when I got my order I had only 3 sandwichs and a baked potato..there were no condiments for the sandwich or loaded potatoes and I didnt get my dessert. When I called about the matter the lady didnt apologize just said the driver is on his way back with the missing items. I explained that my sandwiches would be cold which they were and she said "if you keep them in the container they should be ok". Well she was wrong they were cold and had to be warmed in the microwave...good to know I wasted $39.00 for a microwave meal!! They need better customer service and she never apologized or offered to compensate me for the cold food so I wont waste more money with them that has to be warmed up in a microwave before I eat it...not for $39 I wont smh

They doing baby ear piercing here. The staff that work at the jewellery store are really friendly. They ways gave two staff to pierce baby ears as they do both at the same time to prevent added stress to the child which is perfect

Ignite Records is the best record store in the city. A real vinyl cavern that is packed with fairly priced records to suit a wide range of tastes. Rich (the owner) is a real gent, very knowledgeable and accommodating. The store is friendly and welcoming. Important we keep this indie going!
Legendary Birmingham fixture! Great place to get alternative/rock clothing and accessories  in an iconic location in the centre of town for nearly 50 years.

I have been going to Oasis for over 10 years now and every time you go in it is exciting, literally like a kid in a sweet shop. There is always something new and exciting going on. Highly recommend it!

Oasis has lost it appeal and is no longer a fashion markets. It's now full of rude and over priced tattoo parlours and pretentious "clothing shops". Not to mention the shops selling drug paraphernalia. 

Both inside and out the markets are rundown and are stuck in the 1980s and is in need of updating and bring in to this millennium. 
The markets also attracts the wrong kind of people and is a center of anti-social behaviour. I have often seen the police and security patrolling and moving people on. 

The Oasis markets are full of empty stalls and shops, which adds to the rundown feeling.

In conclusion, I would not recommend visting the markets for this reason.

First time here, and most likely will not be back. Food was good however service was lacking. Wait staff was inattentive and never looked past the table he was at to see if others needed assistance. The ground beef has a nearly equal portion of peppers in it, something that is not expected. I love peppers, but not that much! Worth a visit for sure, but not my favorite place to go by any means.

Probably one of the best options for Mexican food in Apple Valley if not the best. Their table side guacamole is excellent and the prices are more than reasonable for what you get. They have also proven themselves very attentive and helpful when we dined there with a larger group. There are cheaper options probably for Mexican fair but you get what you pay for. They also have coupons in the paper fairly often and the fajitas for two is an excellent money saver and honestly is enough food for three or even four people.

We stopped in for a late lunch as this is one of our favorite restaurants. Service is always good but this time we were lucky enough to get Elias D as our waiter. He has to be one of the kindest and most efficient waiters. He had our chips and salsas to the table before we had even settled in. His knowledge of the menu was outstanding and not to mention the guacamole he made for us at our table was awesome. Thanks Elias D for the very enjoyable experience. :)

Decor is lovely! Service was quick and very courteous even during peek hrs on Friday night. The food was fine but I had been hoping for an authentic Mexican place. Here they served ranch along w their mild salsa to go with the (excellent) chips and “nacho cheese sauce” over the chimichangas. Just wasn’t what I had been looking for.

Not sure what happened to this place. Last two times we were here the service has been incredibly slow. Took over 30 minutes to get our food when it wasn't even busy. Food is good but comes out cold. The woman who sat us threw the menus on the table, she also happened to be our waitress. After that it took her approximately 10 minutes to come back to get our drink order. We come here often, but after these last few visits, I'm not sure we will be back.

My family got dinner as take out from Ramsey’s tonight. Besides the food always being great at this restaurant when you order take out they give you an approximate time when your food will be ready. It shouldn’t be approximate, it should be exact. As I was walking in the door 15 minutes after they told me over the phone it would be ready, I saw the food come out of the kitchen and was bagged by the bar tender. It’s nice to get home and have hot delicious food! Do yourself a favor and get the fried green tomatoes!

Ramsey’s is a local institution. Local down home atmosphere. Home made everything. A large assortment of pies that you can order by the slice or an entire pie. You won’t have t go alone because if you ask anyone they are sure to say yes I’ll go too. The staff are chill and the portions are generous.

Good food, reasonably priced, great service! Best Meat-and-Three in town. Plus, you HAVE to order a piece of pie, they are to die for!

Food is excellent at b all 4 locations...parking is easiest at Harrodsburg Road location.

We will be back!
Amazing hospitality. Our server Annie was great. Choices for all types of eaters. Vegetarian options and comfort food options. Relaxed atmosphere. It’s a special place.

Was a great dining experience.staff was friendly and on it,food was amazing. 6 year old thought it was amazing, toys to play with, and a peanut butter a banana sandwich. Thought he could only get them at Grandma's.

I love the Chop House. The food is hands down the best in Ann Arbor. We always go for the cheese platter appetizer and it is some of the best you will find. The prices are a little steep but once you taste the food, it is well worth it. The cocktails are alright and they need a bit more mixing before being served as they aren't a uniform flavor but outside of that, I highly recommend this place for an anniversary or birthday or just a nice date. Their cigar lounge is high quality and the atmosphere is perfect. I will always come back to this place.

A couple weeks ago, we enjoyed a dinner elsewhere in Ann Arbor and decided to head to Chop House after for an espresso and cigar. After a half mile walk we arrive to find out the cigar bar is non smoking due to a private party. Fine. No problem, we should have called. Tonight, we did the same thing. Except we called first to make sure the cigar lounge was open, we called, yes it’s open. Perfect, we walk there. Guess what, closed. Continuous bad service from this place. It’s overpriced we all know that, but it used to at least have good service. Not anymore. Save yourself the dull experience and go to the steak house around the corner.

The steaks were tender and thick and all of the appetizers were great. We also had very good service. It's a pretty fancy establishment. And they offer great discounts for birthdays. Roughly enough to make the birthday persons meal free, given that it's on the actual birthday.

Went here on two occasions. One was my girlfriend's birthday. It was a wonderful time. The staff were friendly and very speedy, and food was amazing. However, when I went for my club's business conference, it was a bit hectic-- understandably. Several orders were messed up, but they were corrected surprisingly fast. Overall, a great place to dine!

Pretty awesome place. Went doing restaurant week where you get a 3 course meal or something for $28. I ended up taking my wife for her birthday and got their birthday discount. Got the 11oz steak, calamari, mashed potatoes, and asparagus. All was good. Bathroom was nice and clean but a little intimate since everything is in one little corner. Ambience was great. Recommend seeing Kiara for best service. Overall great experience.

We traveled to Lexington with another couple to enjoy the city. We made a late reservation at Dudley's on Short and arrived at the restaurant about a half an hour early with plans to have a drink at the bar. When we walked in, we were met by Manager Heath Branch, who immediately made us feel so welcome. In fact, all of the staff at this beautiful restaurant were efficient, friendly and so very helpful. We had a drink in the bar, and when a table was ready, Mr. Branch personally sat us at a very lovely corner table in a quiet spot in the dining room. Dinner was spectacular, and on top of that, Mr. Branch provided each of us with sample of a delicious appetizer, and thanking us for our patience as we waited for a table to open. Dudley's is a special experience. We will be back!

Nicely prepared food and cozy atmosphere, but portion sizes are inconsistent.  For instance, my entree was a normal size but she ordered   scallops. They were over $40 but only got 3 very small scallops, a few pieces of miscellaneous vegetables and couple tablespoons the "soup/sauce". It was great, but just light handed on what we got for the money. Wait staff also forgot about us for a while. We waited quite a while before requesting to see the dessert menu, and again had to wait a while to even request the check

This is still our favorite restaurant in Lexington even with all the new ones. Everything: food, service, and atmosphere is always spot-on! We are always delighted when Taylor is our waiter. The breads, muffins, and desserts from their fantastic pastry chef are a not to be missed!

Dudley's is an absolutely LOVELY restaurant. Sometimes their waits are a little long so definitely get on Open Table and make a reservation. Every time someone is in town this is where I take them. It has a quiet atmosphere, tasty food, and good service. I also will sit at their bar some Sundays alone and indulge in their designated Sunday menu.

Dudley's is always magnificent, but I don't know if is ever been there for lunch. It was as great as always, and our server, Catlee (Katlee?) was wonderful, giving our group of six ample time to converse, seeming to know intuitively when we were ready to order, ready for more coffee, and never rushing us to finish and open the table. Great food allowing for shared pleasure. What's not to love about Dudley's?
Great place.  Went for our anniversary and they treated us fantastic. Will definitely be back.
This was a wedding celebration.  The salads were fresh and delicious.  The entrees were excellent and plentiful.  The wait staff was efficient and friendly.

I know, I know, you're thinking, "Another Italian joint-- big deal." But would you look at that steak? Just look at it! It was cooked to perfection and the accompanying horse radish sauce was to DIE for. I recommend giving it a go. Oh, did I mention they have bread? Yes, and addictive butter too!
Awesome food. Amazing place. Great.
We had a  private dinner very nice food.
Great place! The ling cod dinner is amazing! Get it spicy. Also the happy hour has $2 pints--you can get ripped for like ten bucks

This is a lively place, with an extensive selection to choose from of some of the best sushi we have ever eaten. They serve cocktails as well, so it is not your traditional Japanese restaurant, but with a college town twist. The atmosphere is louder but not out of hand. It is expensive but you get what you pay for.
A hidden gem in an amazing city. Great environment and price.
The food here makes me angry because I live 1000 miles away and can't come back every week. Probably the best sushi I've had outside of Japan (and better than some I've had in Japan).

Very beautiful location. The food is great quality and extremely original. I was very surprised by the combinations of ingredients that made a simple roll a explosion of interesting flavors. Downside, the waiting time...but if you are not in a rush, is way worth it! ☆

PLEASE do not use your card at this location. My card was charged twice in error. The second charge was for a meal tab that wasn’t even mine! When I contacted the restaurant, and spoke with Susan about the credit card error, she informed me that they cannot afford to reimburse me because they would be losing out on money. She informed me I should contact the group of friends I was dining with to obtain the money that was overcharged on my credit card. This “one star” is for the Restaurant Manager (Matt), who was kind enough to assist me due to Susan’s incompetence. The people of Lexington always talk about how Malone’s has the best food and service but I’m not sure if this statement is true due to the experience I have encountered. This was my first time to Malone’s and it will probably be my last. I am appalled at what transpired and how they treat their customers. This is unacceptable and unprofessional.

The food is sooo good. Its a nice atmosphere and reasonable price for what you get. The waiters are excellent. Its almost as if you have your own personal waiter there just for you. Damn, I just ate there tonight but now I want to go back. Thanks google reviews

If you want superb service with impeccable food, visit Malone’s. Our most recent visit was to this location and management went above and beyond to make sure our Valentine’s Day dinner was perfect. Not lying, food was perfection, and I eat out a LOT lol. We had the sweetest waitress. Will definitely return to Malone’s!

When we visit Lexington, Malone's is always our choice for lunch or dinner. The steaks are always perfect, burgers are huge and tasty, shrimp is fantastic as well. This particular Malone's is a bit smaller and has a more intimate feel which we enjoy. Lunchtime we have never had to wait to be seated. The staff is very nice and there are constantly managers visible and/or checking in to make sure you are satisfied with your visit. If you've not eaten here, you will not be disappointed! (unless you prefer Coke over Pepsi 😉)

My husband and I come here frequently while traveling to Lexington. We went this past weekend and Michelle was our server on Friday. She was the sweetest! Truly a wonderful server.  The food was just as great as usual. Thanks Malone's, see you for the Keeneland meet!

Wouldn't let me give a zero! Went there for Valentine's Day it was a free-for-all. they were allowing people to see themselves there were people jumping in front of other people there was no order to it whatsoever my family and I waited for over an hour when it finally got the table from we were waiting on someone jumped in front of us yet no one did anything! Horrible service
This place is first class...
Worst meal I've had there in years.

OUTSTANDING!!! The food was excellent (never had better) and the service was wonderful. We had Ashley, Skyler, and Drew. Attentive, prompt, and fun! I could probably eat my wait in Lexingtonian salad. Thanks!!
Went to Drakes first time....cant say anything but fantastic....everything was awesome!
